title: Actions: Let’s Start with the Body
description: A practical course in performance focused on physically engaging time and space with objects and materials in order to create an extension of the participantâs current studio practice. Participants will conceptualize, plan and realize performance projects as agreed upon in consultation with the instructor. As a group, through conversations on individual projects and assigned readings, weâll look to contextualize our work within the history of performance and contemporary issues. The aim of this course is to encourage development of individual performative methodologies to inform, and perhaps alter, the nature of the studentsâ artistic practice. This class will be of particular interest to students who might want to take advantage of the instructorâs expertise in movement, choreography, and the historical intersections between dance and art. Permission of instructor required for enrollment. Enrollment limited to 12. Melinda Ring Please come to the first class ready to discuss your current interests, ideas, and the impetus that prompts you to work with performance (show and tell).
